snippet: Community guns, hidden away and shared by small groups of people who use them when needed, then return them, appear to be on the rise in New York, the police say.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column notes the rise in New York City of community guns--firearms that are hidden away, shared by small groups of people who use them when needed, and then return them; observes that police attribute the rise to tough economic times and dwindling resources among gangs.
lead_paragraph: Community guns, hidden away and shared by small groups of people who use them when needed, then return them, appear to be on the rise in New York, the police say.
